name: The Standard Downtown LA

reviews.title: as expected
reviews.text: Check-in was smooth though early check-in was not possible this Saturday morning. Room was available promptly at 3 pm.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a wonderful lunch at the rooftop bar; service a little slow but food tasty, if a little ill presented for the windy rooftop conditions (salad lettuce blowing everywhere.) couch-like loungers very cozy for two or more, loved the Astroturf, outdoor fireplace a nice touch as well. Nice to be able to eat outside in December but this is a place beckoning for summer evening drinks.
reviews.title: in love

likes.disliked: — i ripped my pants on the pool table.

reviews.text: We got a gigantic room (corner) on the 9th floor. (staff told us that the floor right beneath the rooftop pool can be rather loud at night and suggested that if we minded that to stay on a lower floor) room was decorated nicely, appropriate to the rest of the hotel’s aesthetic (white, yellow, grey). While it was indeed gigantic for a city hotel, the room’s walls felt rather stark for the size. Linens were clean and adequate the bed was mediocre. Everything appeared clean but the interior side of the shower curtain had 3 different types of hair on it before either of us got in and a remnant of unused soap remained on the sunken tub’s ledge. Shower pressure stunk. Entire hotel smells like smoke – even our “non-smoking” room and hallways – but this is a party hotel the place smells like beer, sex and cigarettes because that’s what a lot of their customers are there for. We were there on the day of the UCLA/USC game and a few rooms down from us was some kind of afternoon party that was loud and drunk. Who cares - they were just having a good time. Lots of mid-twenties guests this day.
reviews.title: The (Sub) Standard

likes.liked: — The view from the rooftop bar

reviews.text: We ate dinner at the restaurant. Food was alright, described better than it turned out to be. Bread was tasty and warmed as was the calamari. Vibe was very upscale, hipster diner-ish; though cheekily designed and low-light. Menu was different than what is online. Service was indifferent; pushy and hurried though only was at half capacity. I asked for two items from the lunch menu (I’m pregnant and had my heart set on the onion soup and onion/goat cheese tart!) and was told by the waiter, who didn't even bother to check with the chefs, that the request couldn’t be accommodated even though those items were available for dinner through room service. (Is this is a shared kitchen?) Waiter seemed to feel his only job was to deliver food not a decent experience. As we were leaving, we said something about the ridiculous amount of coffee grains in our coffee, even showing the guy and as he walked away he said “well, that’s what happens when it’s made fresh.” (?)
reviews.title: The Standard
this place rocks
reviews.text: We pre-ordered our breakfast the night before; it was delivered exactly on time, hot and served with a smile. The prices on the breakfast struck us as unusually low for a hotel, ditto the meager service charge of $1.50. (e.g. – French toast at $7 and 3 Eggs, home fries or salad, 4 pieces of bacon (of ham, sausage), toast of your choosing, juice, and a pot of coffee/tea filled with 3 full cups all for $12!) They forgo the maple syrup and remedied it within 2 minutes of our calling to request it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was visiting from the East Village in NYC with my GF, and the Standard fit us like a glove with shag carpet lining. From the red key that says "slip it in" to the voyeuristic glass shower wall, we really enjoyed the vibe and the retro stylin' of our hip digs.
reviews.title: Hip downtown vibe from room key to the curtains

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They even had Mr. Bubble in the minibar!
reviews.title: The Standard way below Standard

likes.disliked: — Skybar closed to guests on New Year's Eve!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We actually changed rooms to a room with a soaking tub for 2.
reviews.title: The best rooftop bar and club

reviews.text: Room service breakfast was on time and tasted great. Good: Apple sausage with pancakes and berries.
reviews.title: Go for the Rooftop Bar, but stay somewhere else.

reviews.text: Valet and baggage guys were friendly and cool.
reviews.title: Not ideal for business travelers

reviews.text: This hotel is really cool. Apart from the location which is in the middle of poor mans land filled with homeless people, it is worth the visit.
reviews.title: Definately worth the visit

likes.liked: — The water beds and the bar upstairs

reviews.text: Even if it's just to lie on the water beds, eat in their fabulous diner, play pool, or just have a quick swim. It's definitely worth it.
reviews.title: What a disappointment!

reviews.text: The toilets in the lobby are interesting as you walk through a womans opens legs. The room decor is also cool, we go a massive tub in our room it was really fun.
reviews.title: Cool place right downtown LA

reviews.text: Definitely go there but you might want to hire a car as you can't just take the bus from there, it is about 30 min drive from Hollywood!
reviews.title: A definite for party goers or singles, not a place for families!!!
Dont do it!
reviews.text: While I was expecting a cool hotel with great amenities, I was very disappointed. A group was in town for a work meeting and we opted for the standard-- due to the hype around it. The hotel was DIRTY.... from the hallways to the room itself. While the room tried to be modern, it was overshadowed by the lack of cleanliness. In addition, I expected to get a lotion or shower cap in the bathroom. NO LUCK.... just a shampoo/conditioner. I will not return to the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying at The Standard in Downtown LA was an event in itself, which is good because there is not a lot going on downtown LA. We took the train into downtown and easily got a cab to the Standard. We received a free upgrade to the largest hotel suite I have yet to stay in. It had a giant orange sectional couch and bathroom which featured a giant (5X5) sculpture of a human foot. I liked it. The staff was all friendly and very professional. Dare I say emo. The rooftop bar was a lot of fun, but the average age being about 22 sent me straight in for more botox injections upon my return from this vacation. The drinks were a bit expensive, and I believe my bar tab exceeded 490 dollars (draft beer!) but it was well worth every penny. And as an added kick, they were filming a movie featuring an exploding car right outside our window. At least I hope that was a movie.......and if it wasn't I hope no one was seriously injured.
reviews.title: I loved being the oldest person there!

likes.liked: — Sculpture of large foot in bathroom
likes.disliked: — Could not take sculpture of large foot home on train

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For purposes of demographics and introduction, I'm in my mid 40s and my guest was in her mid-30s.
reviews.title: Interesting design elements, but not a hotel for the masses.

likes.disliked: — Poor customer service. Loud, young party crowd.

reviews.title: Terrible Night
reviews.text: The hotel is very hip, with interesting colors, shapes and textures throughout the room. The hotel and its rooms are actually quite different and I applaud the owners for doing something other than the usual cookie cutter approach that is typically seen.

Now the downside. The hotel is one big loud party for drunken 20-somethings. The top floors smell of smoke, beer and stale cleaning towels. Lower floors are better and our room on the 8th floor was very clean. Many of our neighbors were kids in their twenties and they were up late partying and were very noisy.
reviews.title: Unique and cool.

likes.liked: — The service and teh rooftop bar

reviews.text: I hailed a cab in front of the hotel and as I walked to it, a couple of kids tried to outrun me to the cab. When I told them I had hailed it (and was a half block ahead of them), they called me profanities and threatened to fight me. That gives you some insight as to the mentality (or lack thereof) of the hotel's clientiele.
reviews.title: Pluses & Minuses

aka: The Standard Downtown La Hotel Los Angeles
description: A downtown Los Angeles, California luxury boutique hotel located near the LA Convention Center. This business hotel features 207 guest rooms & suites, event space, rooftop bar and Biergarten, 24 hour restaurant & rooftop pool. The newest addition to the hotel is SPiN - a ping-pong club founded by Susan Sarandon.
